-C.value: try { Use-Icinga -Minimal; } catch { Write-Output 'The Icinga PowerShell Framework is either not installed on the system or not configured properly. Please check https://icinga.com/docs/windows for further details'; Write-Output 'Error:' $$($$_.Exception.Message)Components:`r`n$$( Get-Module -ListAvailable 'icinga-powershell-*' )`r`n'Module-Path:'`r`n$$($$Env:PSModulePath); exit 3; }; Exit-IcingaExecutePlugin -Command 'Invoke-IcingaCheckDirectory'

16.description:
Changes the behavior of the plugin output which check states are printed:
0 (default): Only service checks/packages with state not OK will be printed
1: Only services with not OK will be printed including OK checks of affected check packages including Package config
2: Everything will be printed regardless of the check state
3: Identical to Verbose 2, but prints in addition the check package configuration e.g (All must be [OK])
16.caption: Verbosity

3.description:
Used to specify a path.
e.g. 'C:\Users\Icinga\Downloads'
3.caption: Path

5.description: A switch, which can be set to search through directories recursively.
5.caption: Recurse

12.description:
String that expects input format like "20d", which translates to 20 days. Allowed units: ms, s, m, h, d, w, M, y.

Thereby all files which have a creation date older then 20 days are considered within the check.
12.caption: CreationOlderThan

10.description:
String that expects input format like "20d", which translates to 20 days. Allowed units: ms, s, m, h, d, w, M, y.

Thereby all files which have a change date older then 20 days are considered within the check.
10.caption: ChangeOlderThan

2.description: Change the value your defined threshold checks against from the current value to a collected time threshold of the Icinga for Windows daemon, as described here: https://icinga.com/docs/icinga-for-windows/latest/doc/service/10-Register-Service-Checks/ An example for this argument would be 1m or 15m which will use the average of 1m or 15m for monitoring.
2.caption: ThresholdInterval

8.description:
String that expects input format like "20d", which translates to 20 days. Allowed units: ms, s, m, h, d, w, M, y.

Thereby all files which have been changed 20 days ago are considered within the check.
8.caption: ChangeTimeEqual

11.description:
String that expects input format like "20d", which translates to 20 days. Allowed units: ms, s, m, h, d, w, M, y.

Thereby all files which have been created 20 days ago are considered within the check.
11.caption: CreationTimeEqual

9.description:
String that expects input format like "20d", which translates to 20 days. Allowed units: ms, s, m, h, d, w, M, y.

Thereby all files which have a change date younger then 20 days are considered within the check.
9.caption: ChangeYoungerThan

14.description:
String that expects input format like "20MB", which translates to the filze size 20 MB. Allowed units: B, KB, MB, GB, TB.

Thereby all files with a size of 20 MB or larger are considered within the check.
14.caption: FileSizeGreaterThan

7.description: Used to specify a Warning threshold. Follows the Icinga plugin threshold
7.caption: Warning

15.description:
String that expects input format like "5MB", which translates to the filze size 5 MB. Allowed units: B, KB, MB, GB, TB.

Thereby all files with a size of 5 MB or less are considered within the check.
15.caption: FileSizeSmallerThan

6.description: Used to specify a Critical threshold. Follows the Icinga plugin threshold
6.caption: Critical

4.description:
Used to specify an array of filenames or expressions to match against results to filter for specific files.

e.g '*.txt', '*.sql', finds all files ending with .txt and .sql
4.caption: FileNames

13.description:
String that expects input format like "20d", which translates to 20 days. Allowed units: ms, s, m, h, d, w, M, y.

Thereby all files which have a creation date younger then 20 days are considered within the check.
13.caption: CreationYoungerThan
